title: National Wildlife Corridor Network: Cross-Sectoral Systems Map
description: Designate 100 corridors connecting 670 protected areas for species migration

nodes.label: Biodiversity
nodes.description: Wildlife Corridors: 100 corridors connecting 670 protected areas

nodes.label: Urban Development
nodes.description: City expansion, land use planning, development control

nodes.label: Food & Agriculture
nodes.description: Crop damage, livestock predation, farm compensation

links.quantification: Corridor designation → 10M ha connectivity preserved → genetic diversity maintained → species extinction risk -40%
Wildlife crossings → 200 overpasses/underpasses → animal-vehicle collisions -60% → ₹2K Cr accident costs avoided
Riparian corridor protection → watershed connectivity → river flow regulation → ₹5K Cr ecosystem service value
Human-wildlife conflict: Corridors increase elephant/leopard encounters → ₹3K Cr crop damage + 500 deaths/year → community opposition
Development restrictions: Corridors limit city expansion → ₹20K Cr real estate value affected → political resistance
Ecotourism → corridor wildlife viewing → ₹8K Cr rural income → community support for conservation grows (reinforcing)
Requires compensation fund: Corridors only viable with ₹5K Cr/year crop damage insurance → farmer acceptance prerequisite
Via highway design: Wildlife crossings → infrastructure costs +10% → ₹15K Cr additional investment needed
Via conflict mitigation: Electric fencing → crop damage -50% → farm incomes protected → ₹2K Cr agricultural savings
Via riparian zones: Watershed protection → aquatic connectivity → fish migration restored → freshwater biodiversity +30%
